Exercise 2.3-7

Describe a θ(nlgn)-time algorithm that, given a set S of n integers and another integer x, determines whether or not there exist two elements in S whose sum is exactly x.

Firstly we sort S by way of MERGE-SORT which takes θ(nlgn) time. We then iterate over our sorted array and use BINARY-SEARCH to determine if the integer that would sum to x. BINARY-SEARCH takes θ(lgn) time and doing it n times takes θ(nlgn) time. Since both these steps take θ(nlgn) time, combining the two of them is the same as multiplying that time by a constant factor. Therefore this algorithm runs at θ(nlgn) time.
